main event: On 14 February 1955 in New York City, a ground-visual UFO sighting was reported. The object was described as an oval shape and was sighted three times, appearing brighter on subsequent sightings and exhibiting erratic movements. The report included photographs and indicated a sighting duration of 2-3 minutes with only one object observed. The object's course was from south to north, and intelligence reports suggested that the sighting may have been caused by a searchlight reflection off low cloud layers.
interesting points: The UFO sighting involved an oval-shaped object sighted three times, with subsequent sightings showing it to be considerably brighter.
Photographs were included in the report, supporting the visual observation of the unidentified object.
The sighting lasted 2-3 minutes, and the object was observed to have an erratic course, heading from south to north.
Intelligence reports suggested that the sighting may have been caused by a searchlight reflection off low cloud layers, indicating a potential prosaic explanation for the UFO sighting.
The report was transmitted to the Air Technical Intelligence Center in Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, indicating an official investigation into the event.
